Posts.EditableText:
Is there any way to share an online file?  I would like to be able to share a game I made INCLUDING being able to see the GUI interface.  Or, at least, a way to collaborate on a game online.  I guess that would essentially be the same thing, huh?

Or, at least be able to copy the online creation so that a shared account could be established.

Thanks!
Posts.HTML:
Is there any way to share an online file? I would like to be able to share a game I made INCLUDING being able to see the GUI interface. Or, at least, a way to collaborate on a game online. I guess that would essentially be the same thing, huh?

Or, at least be able to copy the online creation so that a shared account could be established.

Thanks!

Posts.EditableText:
So you mean using the Quest online editor to create a game in collaboration with someone else?

Or do you mean something like both of you working on the game simultaneously, with you both being able to see the changes?  (I'm not sure what you mean by "INCLUDING being able to see the GUI interface". The GUI interface for the game when it's running or the editor while editing?)
Posts.HTML:
So you mean using the Quest online editor to create a game in collaboration with someone else?

Or do you mean something like both of you working on the game simultaneously, with you both being able to see the changes? (I'm not sure what you mean by "INCLUDING being able to see the GUI interface". The GUI interface for the game when it's running or the editor while editing?)

Posts.EditableText:
The first.  Offline, I can create a demo game and send someone the .aslx file so that they can play the game and see how I did things in the GUI as well as edit it.  Or, offline, I can copy the entire game code to a forum or email and someone can paste it into a new game.  I don't see that either option is possible online.  Right?  The only thing I can think of is having a shared user name and password, but that does not seem like the wisest thing to do.

I do not intend on ever working with someone simultaneously.  I would just like to be able to create something (or help someone with a problem by giving them a solution or demo to look at) that can be easily viewed and edited online.

Does that make sense?
Posts.HTML:
The first. Offline, I can create a demo game and send someone the .aslx file so that they can play the game and see how I did things in the GUI as well as edit it. Or, offline, I can copy the entire game code to a forum or email and someone can paste it into a new game. I don't see that either option is possible online. Right? The only thing I can think of is having a shared user name and password, but that does not seem like the wisest thing to do.

I do not intend on ever working with someone simultaneously. I would just like to be able to create something (or help someone with a problem by giving them a solution or demo to look at) that can be easily viewed and edited online.

Does that make sense?

Posts.EditableText: I see what you mean.  Yeah, I don't think that's possible with the current setup. You almost want a Quest variant of Google Docs. :)
Posts.HTML: I see what you mean. Yeah, I don't think that's possible with the current setup. You almost want a Quest variant of Google Docs. :)
